intro: Pupalia distantiflora, commonly known as the distant-flowered pupalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Pupalia distantiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
